content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 3 x"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="y equals f to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: The curve enters the window at (negative 1.8 comma negative 5.5). The curve increases to reach (negative 1 comma negative 1). The curve increases to the origin, becoming nearly horizontal at that point. The curve continues to increase to pass through (1 comma 1) and exit the window at (1.8 comma 5.5).

The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: The curve enters the window at (negative 5.5 comma 0.1). The curve increases to cross the y axis at (0 comma 1). The curve then continues to increase, passing through (1 comma 2) and (2 comma 4) before exiting the window at (2.3 comma 5.5). ​

The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: The curve enters the window at (negative 5.5 comma 0.1). The curve increases to cross the y axis at (0 comma 1). The curve then continues to increase, passing through (1 comma 3) before exiting the window at (1.6 comma 5.5).

The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: The curve begins at the origin. The curve decreases, with an increasingly steep slope to exit the window at (0.9 comma negative 5.5). A second section of the curve enters the window at (1.1 comma 5.5). The curve decreases to pass through (2 comma 1.6) and (3 comma 1) before exiting the window at (5.5 comma 0.7). ​

content.answer: The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right: The curve enters the window at (negative 5.5 comma 0.1). The curve increases to cross the y axis at (0 comma 1). The curve then continues to increase, passing through (1 comma 3) before exiting the window at (1.6 comma 5.5).

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
